relation.name: media
relation.description: The event can have more than one set of media. The media will only be associated with one event.
relation.field: Points to the event to which this belongs.
The file where the media is stored (and its mime type)

relation.name: event
relation.description: Each incident will have a single event.
relation.field: A count of the number of media children (i.e. from the media table.
TigrUID of the author of the report.

field.name: category id
field.description: Previously this was directed toward the primary key of the category table now it points to the tigr id. This is also a perfectly good key field.

field.name: size
field.description: The total size of the incident in kibibytes. Although this is the pre-serialized size it should be sufficient for determining message size. In particular the meta-data is presumed constant. Note that the image size is not the display resolution size. (jpeg files are compressed)

field.name: dest group type
field.description: Type of group report will be broadcasted (Broadcast, Callsign, Unit).

field.name: dest group name
field.description: Destination group identifier to send quick report.

field.name: STATUS
field.description: The status of the report with respect to submission to the gateway plugin.

relation.name: status
relation.description: Each incident will have a single event.
relation.field: A record of an action on the event.
The application key indicating the last use.

relation.name: category
relation.description: This is mostly a lookup table but is can be reconfigured from the server. It is unlikely that there will be an android application which will do anything but read these items.
